encryptionInTransit.title: Manage encryption in-Transit
encryptionInTransit.enableEIT: Enable encryption in transit for this Universe
encryptionInTransit.useSameCert: Use the same certificate for “Node to Node” and “Client to Node” encryption
encryptionInTransit.enableCNAndNNEncryption: Enable “Node to Node” and “Client to Node” Encryption
encryptionInTransit.useRollingUpgrade: Use rolling upgrade to apply this change
encryptionInTransit.rollingUpgradeInputTitle: Set the upgrade delay between servers (Seconds)
encryptionInTransit.changeCTNCertWarning: Note! Changing the client to node root certificate may cause the client to loose connection, please update the certificate used in your client application.
encryptionInTransit.disableEncryptionWarning: Rotating certificates (Root Certificate or Server Certificate) and Enabling/Disabling encryption should be performed at different times.
encryptionInTransit.rootCAModifiedWarning: You have selected a new Certificates Authority for Node to Node encryption. Rotating a Certificates Authority will automatically rotate its associated Server Certificate.
encryptionInTransit.clientRootCAModifiedWarning: You have selected a new Certificates Authority for Client to Node encryption. Rotating a Certificates Authority will automatically rotate its associated Server Certificate.
encryptionInTransit.enableEITWarning: Enable Node to Node encryption or Client to Node encryption to enable encryption in transit.
encryptionInTransit.disableEITWarning: Note! Enabling/Disabling of “Encryption In Transit” or Enabling/Disabling of “Node to Node” or “Client to Node” encryption will be performed as non rolling upgrade.

commonErrors.pageNotExist: Seems like this Page does not exist

encryptionAtRest.deleteConfigConfirmText: Are you sure you want to delete <0>{{configName}}</0> configuration?
encryptionAtRest.deleteConfigWarning: Before deleting this configuration make sure it's not being used by any backups. Note that in order to restore a backup with deleted KMS config <0></0> you'll need to create a new KMS config with the same master key details.

advancedConfig.enableIPV6Helper: Use IPV6 networking for connections between the DB servers.
advancedConfig.enableNetworkAccessHelper: Assign a load balancer or nodeport for connecting to the DB endpoints over the internet.
advancedConfig.title: Advanced Configuration

cloudConfig.mastersInDefaultRegionHelper: Forces placement of all masters in Default Region.

placementStatus.azWarning: Primary data placement is not geo-redundant, universe cannot survive even 1 availability zone failure
placementStatus.multiRegion: Primary data placement is fully geo-redundant, universe can survive at least 1 region failure
placementStatus.noFieldsChanged: At Least One Field Must Be Modified
placementStatus.regionWarning: Primary data placement is geo-redundant, universe can survive at least 1 availability zone failure
placementStatus.singleRF: Primary data placement is not redundant, universe cannot survive even 1 node failure

cloudConfig.title: Cloud Configuration
cloudConfig.colocatedModeHelper: Place Masters on the same nodes as T-Servers
cloudConfig.masterNumNodesHelper: Number of nodes dedicated to Masters is equal to the Universe’s replication factor and can not be modified.
cloudConfig.masterPlacementHelper: Select this option if you plan to use this universe for multi-tenancy use cases -or- you expect to create Databases with a very large number of tables

deleteClusterModal.deleteRRMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this read replica cluster ?
deleteClusterModal.enterUniverseName: Enter universe name to confirm delete:

gFlags.flagNotBelongError: This Flag does not belong to {{server}}. Remove Flag
gFlags.incorrectFlagMsg: Flag name is incorrect. Remove Flag
gFlags.JWKSModalTitle: Paste the JSON web key set (JWKS):
gFlags.JWKSModalNote: Note: You can obtain JWKS from JWKS URI that is part of OIDC discover end point
gFlags.noFlags: There are no flags assigned to this universe
gFlags.title: G-Flags
gFlags.inheritFlagsMsg: Apply the same Flags to primary cluster and Read Replica.
gFlags.rollingMsg: Apply all changes using a rolling restart (slower, zero downtime)
gFlags.nonRollingMsg: Apply all changes immediately, using a concurrent restart (faster, some downtime)
gFlags.nonRestart: Apply all changes which do not require a restart immediately;
gFlags.nonRestartRuntime: apply remaining changes the next time the database is restarted
gFlags.inheritRRModalBody:
Apply the same Flags to both Primary Cluster and Read replica?
This will override all the Flags that are currently applied to Read replica
by Primary Cluster’s Flag.
gFlags.inheritRRModalLine1: Apply the same Flags to both Primary Cluster and Read replica?
gFlags.inheritRRModalLine2: This will override all the Flags that are currently applied to Read replica
gFlags.inheritRRModalConfirmMsg: Are you sure you want to continue with the changes?
gFlags.validationError: Fix all the errors shown below to proceed
gFlags.invalidKey: Invalid attribute key or missing '=' between key value pair
gFlags.jwksNotSupported: Please select database versions 2.18 or above to upload JWKS
gFlags.missingAttributeValue: Missing value for the attribute key
gFlags.missingQuoteAttributeValue: Missing quotes or having spaces within attribute values
gFlags.hbaConfDescription: Input each record as a new row, then reorder them. The sequential order of the records are significant as they are searched serially for every connection request.
gFlags.identConfDescriptionSecond: Enter each mapping as a new row, comprising the map-name, external user name, and database user name.
gFlags.identConfDescriptionMore: To incorporate user name mappings from this flag, add them to the authentication methods that use external user names in hba_conf_csv file.
gFlags.flagsModifiedModalBody1: The Gflags has been modified in another tab/browser/device.
gFlags.flagsModifiedModalBody2: If you don't want to lose modified flags, please reload the page.
gFlags.flagsModifiedModalLine2: Note that current changes will be lost.

instanceConfig.assignPublicIPHelper: Assign a public IP to the DB servers for connections over the internet.
instanceConfig.dedicatedNodesHelper: Place tserver and master processes on separate nodes.
instanceConfig.ephemeralStorage: ! Selected instance type is with ephemeral storage, If you will pause this universe your data will get lost.
instanceConfig.title: Instance Configuration
instanceConfig.useTimeSyncHelper: Enable the {{provider}} Time Sync functionality for the DB servers.

authSettings.title: Authentication Settings
authSettings.enableYsqlOrYcql: Need to enable at least one endpoint among YSQL and YCQL
authSettings.enableYCQLHelper: Enable the YCQL API endpoint to run cassandra compatible workloads.
authSettings.enableYEDISHelper: Enable the YEDIS API endpoint to run REDIS compatible workloads.
authSettings.enableYSQLHelper: Enable the YSQL API endpoint to run postgres compatible workloads.

encryptionSettings.title: Encryption Settings
encryptionSettings.enableClientToNodeTLSHelper: Enable Client-to-Node encryption to use TLS enabled connection for communication between a client (ex: Database application, ysqlsh, ycqlsh) and the Universe YSQL -or- YCQL endpoint.
encryptionSettings.enableEncryptionAtRestHelper: Enable encryption for data stored on the tablet servers.
encryptionSettings.enableNodeToNodeTLSHelper: Enable Node-to-Node encryption to use TLS enabled connections for communication between different Universe nodes.

resizeNodeModal.modalDescription: This operation will be performed without restart

smartResizeModal.modalDescription: This operation will migrate this universe and all its data to a completely new set of nodes Or alternatively you could try smart resize (This will change VM image {{value}} for existing nodes)

fullMoveModal.modalDescription: This operation will migrate this universe and all its data to a completely new set of nodes.

validation.passwordStrength: Password must be 8 characters minimum and must contain at least 1 digit, 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase and one of the !@#$%^&* (special) characters.
validation.universeNameValidation: {{cloudType}} Universe name cannot contain capital letters or special characters except dashes

advisor.NoPerformanceIssues: Performance Advisor didn't find any performance issues
advisor.FailedToLoad: Failed to load. Try again later
advisor.ReviewLoadBalancing: If you are load balancing in your application or client, review your implementation.
advisor.ScanCluster: Scan the cluster for performance tuning recommendations
advisor.RunWorkload: For meaningful results, run your workload for at least 1 hour before doing a scan.
advisor.IndexPerformanceTuning: Learn more about index performance tuning
advisor.DropIndex: Connect to the database and use DROP INDEX to delete the unused indexes.
advisor.RangeSharding: Recreate the indexes using range sharding
advisor.DBScanFailed: Failed to scan the database. Try again later.

error.failToFetchUniverse: Error fetching details for the universe with the UUID: {{universeUuid}}
error.failToFetchDrConfig: Error fetching details for the DR config with the UUID: {{drConfigUuid}}

enableDrPrompt.featureDescription: Enable <bold>Active-Active Single-Master Disaster Recovery</bold> (DR) for near-zero recovery point objective (RPO) & recovery time objective (RTO) in the event of a universe outage.

banner.enablingDr: <bold>Enabling disaster recovery...</bold> Universe operations are not available while the operation is in progress.
banner.failoverInProgress: <bold>Failover in progress...</bold> Universe operations are not available while the operation is in progress.
banner.connectYourApps: <bold>Connect your applications</bold> to the new DR primary universe to direct read and writes to it.
banner.drConfigHalted: <bold>Warning!</bold> DR replication stream has been manually halted.
banner.drConfigRestartRequired: <bold>Warning!</bold> DR replication failed which means the DR replica is severely out-of-sync with the DR primary.

failoverImmediately.description: Start failover immediately at the cost of losing some data that is not replicated to the standby universe yet.

waitForReplicationDrain.description: Wait for the standby cluster to be fully synchronized with the primary by draining replication before failing over.

estimatedDataLoss.label: Estimated data loss
estimatedDataLoss.tooltip: Data loss is estimated based on the internal clock skew on the standby cluster.

note.stopWorkload: <bold>Stop application workloads</bold> before initiating failover as all <bold>writes will be rejected</bold> during failover.

abortModal.title: Abort Failover
abortModal.instruction: The replication drain is erroring out. To proceed with failover, accept the estimated data loss of {{estimatedDataLoss}}ms.
abortModal.acknowledge: I understand and acknowledge the estimated data loss of {{estimatedDataLoss}}ms.

drStatus.label: DR status
drStatus.tooltip: Disaster Recovery (DR) utilizes asynchronous replication to ensure consistency between the primary and standby universe. An unhealthy stream means there is significant replication lag.

estimatedDataLoss.label: Estimated data loss
estimatedDataLoss.tooltip: If you would like to failover, this is the estimated data loss measured in time. This is estimated based on the clock skew of tablets on the standby universe.

property.minSafeTimeLagAcrossAllTables: Minimum Safe Time Lag across all tables

selectTargetUniverse.instruction: 1. Select a universe to use as the DR replica.

selectDatabases.instruction: 2. Select the databases to enable disaster recovery for.
selectDatabases.pitrSetUpNote: Note: Point-in-time Recovery will be enabled for the selected databases on the DR Replica.

configureBootstrap.backupStorageConfig: Select the backup storage config to use for bootstrapping.
configureBootstrap.bootstrapOffPeakNote: Note: We recommend setting up Disaster Recovery during off-peak hours if bootstrap is required.

configureRpo.instruction: 4. Configure RPO threshold to receive alerts.
configureRpo.submitButton: Set up and Enable Disaster Recovery

error.requestFailure: Create active-active single-master disaster recovery (DR) request failed
error.taskFailure: Failed to enable active-active single-master disaster recovery (DR).

success.taskSuccess: Active-active single-master disaster recovery (DR) is now enabled.

deleteModal.title: Remove Active-Active Single-Master Disaster Recovery (DR): {{drConfigName}}
deleteModal.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to remove disaster recovery?
deleteModal.deleteConsequence: Your databases will no longer be replicated and there will be no DR replica universe to failover to in case of a disaster.
deleteModal.confirmationInstructions: Enter DR config name to proceed.

error.requestFailure: Active-active single-master disaster recovery (DR) removal request failed
error.taskFailure: Active-active single-master disaster recovery (DR) removal task failed.

backupStorageConfig.label: Backup Storage Config
backupStorageConfig.tooltip: <paragraph>Ensure that the backup storage config <bold>can be accessed from both source and target universe.</bold></paragraph><paragraph>Particularly, <bold>Network File System (NFS)</bold> based storage configs may not be accessible from universes in different regions.</paragraph>

error.backupStorageConfigRequired: Please select a backup storage config.

configureBootstrap.infoText: Initial seeding is required when the database contains data. This involves a process called bootstrapping. Bootstrapping requires a backup storage config as an intermediate third party storage, and is <bold>time and resource intensive.</bold>

backupStorageConfig.label: Backup Storage Config
backupStorageConfig.tooltip: <paragraph>Ensure that the backup storage config <bold>can be accessed from both source and target universe.</bold></paragraph><paragraph>Particularly, <bold>Network File System (NFS)</bold> based storage configs may not be accessible from universes in different regions.</paragraph>

editTablesModal.instruction: Select the databases to enable disaster recovery for

composer.helpText: All Alert Policies that generate {{type}} alerts will use this notification template.

alertVariablesPreviewModal.info: Choose the Alert Template to preview with the Email Notification Template.

rollbackModal.title: Rollback to Default Template
rollbackModal.helpText: Rollback to default template will discard your current edits and revert the template back to the out-of-box version. Do you want to proceed?

alertPolicyDetails.variableTitle: Custom variables used by the notification channels

emptyVariableList.title: No custom variables
emptyVariableList.subText: Custom variables are key-value pairs created in the <bold>Notification Channels / Customize Notification Templates</bold> page. You can use them to define custom values to show in alert notifications.

variablesList.helpText: Choose the values to display in the actual alert notifications.

tablespaces.checkboxTitle: Restore tablespaces and data to their respective regions
tablespaces.checkboxHelpText: Note! If you don't select this option, or the target universe doesn't have a matching topology, all data will be restored to the primary region.

unSupportedModal.title: Unable to Restore Tablespaces
unSupportedModal.warningText: Note! You can proceed without restoring tablespaces, however none of the tablespaces are preserved and all their data is written to the primary region [location]. After the restore, you will have to re-add all the tablespaces. Learn more
unSupportedModal.subTitle: Tablespaces that don't meet the requirements for the restore
unSupportedModal.topologyMismatch: Topology mismatch with the target Universe
unSupportedModal.nameAlreadyExists: Name already exists in the target universe
